title: Convergence of series using Limit Comparison Test

content.question: Which of the following statements about the series <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mi>n</mi> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mi>n</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41C6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is true?

choices.label: The series diverges by the nth term test.

The series diverges by limit comparison to the harmonic series <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mi>n</mi> </mfrac> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ED4@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
The series converges by the nth term test

The series converges by limit comparison to the geometric series <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mi>n</mi> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FD1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
